Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2010 06:31PM helenap wrote: my dog was diagnosed with cancer the same day I was diagnosed.. his was mast cell tumors, grade 3 mitiobolic rate 6 which means he had 6 months to live without treament. LIke people, he went through surgery and chemo for the last 6 months and TODAY was released from the vet... with check ups.. so please stay positive.. cancer can be beaten by people and by dogs... i pray every day and send drool (have basset hound) for my sisters on this board. i hope my post gives some encouragement to lukejessmon....
Posts.Title: More Bad News lukejessesmom raeinnz

Posts.Content: May 19, 2010 12:08PM helenap wrote: I am signed up for June 11th and it is comng fast.. trying to figure out what I need to know for recovery and making life easier at home.. doing the simple mast I hope.... and trying to avoid any future surgery... they say it is only 1-2 percent re-occurence but then again 1 in 8 get breast cancer and we find ourselves in that group so I am not feeling lucky... so good wishes to all
Posts.Title: June 2010 Mastectomy jsmiley60 reneemac

Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2010 01:33PM helenap wrote: this is the same as mammosite radiation. I am doing this myself.. well at least I think I am. I have an appt with my surgeon this afternoon and if i learned anything during this process is that you are the captain of your own diagnosis and you need to take control and learn as much as you can. and you need to talk to everyone. I made appts with the phsycial doctor, the radiologist, the surgeron *threee times and the oncologoist before making my decision. This is my life and I intend to live it beyond this diagnosis.
